item.source: Flash code (beginner's code XD) i need help

item.title: Flash code (beginner's code XD) i need help
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:2, topic:447895”]Is that AS2?
If so, where are that code snippet placed?
If not, that isn’t valid/good code.
And please remember the [size=24pt];[/size]s

PS: You should really use AS3 instead of AS2. Much more efficient.

EDIT:
This should work:

// Place in Object1
on (press) {
this.startDrag();
alpha = -50;
if (this, hitTest(_root.Goal)) {
nextFrame();
}
}
on (release) {
this.stopDrag();
alpha = 0;
}

You just need some way of continuous checking for hit, as your current code would only check it when you press the object.[/quote]
thank you bowser ~<3

Read full topic
item.source: Flash code (beginner's code XD) i need help

item.title: Flash code (beginner's code XD) i need help
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Is that AS2?
If so, where are that code snippet placed?
If not, that isn’t valid/good code.
And please remember the [size=24pt];[/size]s

PS: You should really use AS3 instead of AS2. Much more efficient.

EDIT:
This should work:

// Place in Object1
on (press) {
this.startDrag();
alpha = -50;
if (this, hitTest(_root.Goal)) {
nextFrame();
}
}
on (release) {
this.stopDrag();
alpha = 0;
}

You just need some way of continuous checking for hit, as your current code would only check it when you press the object.

item.title: Flash code (beginner's code XD) i need help
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

on (press) { startDrag (Object1) alpha = -50; if (_root.Object1, hitTest(_root.Goal)) { nextFrame() } } on (release) { stopDrag () alpha = 0; }

that does not seem to work, can someone help me fix it?

pretty much when object1 colides in any way with goal it = next frame.
